IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ESTABLISHED IN 1983, THE ALPHA DELTA PI FOUNDATION ACCEPTS TAX DEDUCTIBLE GIFTS TO PROVIDE ESSENTIAL RESOURCES FOR ALPHA DELTA PI SORORITY'S EDUCATIONAL, LEADERSHIP AND PHILANTHROPIC ACTIVITIES. THE FOUNDATION FUNDS A VARIETY OF OPPORTUNITIES THAT BENEFIT ALPHA DELTA PI SORORITY AND ITS MEMBERS AS WELL AS THE PRESERVATION OF MONUMENTS AND MEMORIALS THAT ARE UNIQUE TO ALPHA DELTA PI SORORITY'S PLACE IN HISTORY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ESTABLISHED IN 1983, THE ALPHA DELTA PI FOUNDATION ACCEPTS TAX DEDUCTIBLE GIFTS TO PROVIDE ESSENTIAL RESOURCES FOR ALPHA DELTA PI SORORITY'S EDUCATIONAL, LEADERSHIP, AND PHILANTHROPIC ACTIVITIES. THE FOUNDATION FUNDS A VARIETY OF OPPORTUNITIES THAT BENEFIT ALPHA DELTA PI SORORITY AND ITS MEMBERS, AS WELL AS THE PRESERVATION OF MONUMENTS AND MEMORIALS THAT ARE UNIQUE TO ALPHA DELTA PI SORORITY'S PLACE IN HISTORY.
IRS990.Desc: THE ALPHA DELTA PI FOUNDATION IS PROUD TO AWARD APPROXIMATELY 175 COMPETITIVE ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS EACH YEAR WITH A TOTAL OF MORE THAN $250,000 IN SCHOLARSHIPS. AWARD AMOUNTS VARY UP TO $5,000, AND SCHOLARSHIPS UP TO $5,035 ARE AVAILABLE FOR UNDERGRADUATE, GRADUATE, AND CONTINUING EDUCATION STUDY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING WAS PROVIDED BY GRANTS MADE FROM THE ALPHA DELTA PI FOUNDATION FOR CHAPTER MEMBERS, ADVISORS, AND ALUMNAE ATTENDING OFFICER ACADEMY. ADDITIONALLY, RESOURCES FOR OUR UNDERGRADUATE MEMBERS ARE MADE AVAILABLE FOR THE CONTINUED FIGHT TO PREVENT HAZING, TO SUPPORT MENTAL WELLNESS, AND IN PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS SEXUAL AND RELATIONSHIP MISCONDUCT, BINGE DRINKING, HAZING, AND BULLYING.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE CLASPED HANDS FUND GRANT PROVIDES EMERGENCY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO ALUMNAE WHO FIND THEMSELVES IN FINANCIAL DISTRESS. NEED AND CIRCUMSTANCES DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF EACH GRANT. IN 2021-22, THE FOUNDATION GRANTED FUNDS TO 16 INDIVIDUALS WHO WERE FACING FINANCIAL DISTRESS.THE ABIGAIL DAVIS EMERGENCY GRANT FUND PROVIDES GRANTS OF UP TO $3,500 FOR SHORT-TERM ASSISTANCE TO COLLEGIANS WHO ARE EXPERIENCING UNFORESEEN FINANCIAL DIFFICULTIES. GRANTS MUST BE USED FOR TUITION, BOOKS, OR SCHOOL FEES. GRANTS MAY NOT BE USED FOR SORORITY DUES OR ROOM AND BOARD. THE FOUNDATION PROVIDED 8 ONE-TIME EMERGENCY GRANTS TO UNDERGRADUATE MEMBERS TO ENSURE THEY COULD CONTINUE THEIR EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: THE FOUNDATION MADE GIFTS TO CONSTRUCT THE THE QUALIFYING EDUCATIONAL PORTION OF COLLEGIATE CHAPTER HOUSING.

THE FOUNDATION FUNDS A VARIETY OF OTHER OPPORTUNITIES THAT BENEFIT ALPHA DELTA PI SORORITY AND ITS MEMBERS, AS WELL AS THE PRESERVATION OF MONUMENTS AND MEMORIALS THAT ARE UNIQUE TO ALPHA DELTA PI SORORITY'S PLACE IN HISTORY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION HAS A POLICY FOR ITS DONOR RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS OF APPROPRIATING FOR DISTRIBUTION EACH YEAR AN ESTABLISHED PERCENTAGE OF 4.25% OF THE ROLLING PRIOR 12-QUARTER AVERAGE MARKET VALUE LESS CUMULATIVE UNREALIZED GAINS/LOSSES THROUGH JANUARY 31 PRECEDING THE FISCAL YEAR IN WHICH THE DISTRIBUTION IS PLANNED, PLUS AN ADMINISTRATIVE FEE OF NO MORE THAN 3% OF THE MARKET VALUE LESS UNREALIZED GAINS/LOSSES AS OF JANUARY 31. IN ESTABLISHING THIS POLICY, THE FOUNDATION CONSIDERED THE LONG-TERM EXPECTED RETURN ON ITS ASSETS HELD FOR ENDOWMENT. THE FOUNDATION'S OBJECTIVE IS TO MAINTAIN THE PURCHASING POWER OF THE ENDOWMENT ASSETS HELD IN PERPETUITY AS WELL AS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL REAL GROWTH THROUGH NEW GIFTS AND INVESTMENT RETURN.

THE FOUNDATION IS ORGANIZED AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION THAT IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE UNITED STATES INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND SIMILAR STATE LAW. ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA REQUIRE MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE FOUNDATION AND RECOGNIZE A TAX LIABILITY IF THE FOUNDATION HAS TAKEN AN UNCERTAIN POSITION THAT MORE LIKELY THAN NOT WOULD NOT BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY VARIOUS FEDERAL AND STATE TAXING AUTHORITIES. MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE FOUNDATION, AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JULY 31, 2023 AND 2022, THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY OR DISCLOSURE IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOUNDATION IS SUBJECT TO ROUTINE AUDITS BY TAXING JURISDICTIONS; HOWEVER, THERE ARE CURRENTLY NO AUDITS FOR ANY TAX PERIODS IN PROGRESS. THE FOUNDATION HAS FILED ITS FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAX RETURNS FOR PERIODS THROUGH JULY 31, 2022. THESE INCOME TAX RETURNS ARE GENERALLY OPEN TO EXAMINATION BY THE RELEVANT TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR A PERIOD OF THREE YEARS FROM THE LATER OF THE DATE THE RETURN WAS FILED OR ITS DUE DATE (INCLUDING APPROVED EXTENSIONS).

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: ALPHA OMICRON OF ALPHA DELTA PI
GAMMA IOTA OF ADPI HOUSE CORP
ZETA BETA OF ADPI HOUSE CORP

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, CONTROLLER, VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCE, AND AUDIT COMMITTEE AND THEN SUBMITTED TO THE BOARD FOR APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IS VERY AWARE OF CONFLICT OF INTEREST AS IT HELPS MAINTAIN THE REPUATION OF EXCELLENCE AND HIGH STANDARDS THAT IS INSTILLED IN ITS MEMBERS. BOARD MEMBERS ARE WELL VERSED IN POLICY PROTOCOL, AND ARE CONSCIENTIOUS IN BRINGING THE SUBJECT UP AT MEETINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD MUST APPROVE AND VOTE ON THE SALARIES OF ALL OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES WHO RECEIVE A SALARY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
